file_content.text: On your feet, soldiers.
Lieutenant Jorgan? What are you doing here?
It's "captain" now. And I'm getting you out of here.
It's "sergeant" now. Don't ask. And I'm getting you out of here.
I'm getting you out of here.
Thought we'd have been out of here weeks ago. Who's this?
I'm the commander of Havoc Squad.
I'm Jorgan's CO.
Havoc Squad? It's an honor, sir.
Okay, enough boot-kissing. I want answers, Torve. For starters, how'd you get yourselves captured?
Hold on--you knew someone would come rescue you?
You've been expecting us?
That was part of the plan, wasn't it?
If I didn't know better, I'd say you sounded ungrateful.
I hope you're not complaining.
No, sir. Just been sitting here longer than we planned.
Plan? What plan?
It's all there in our mission outline. Didn't Zane brief you?
Zane? As in "Senior Agent Zane"? Man's been nothing but trouble for us.
So he didn't--oh. Then I'm afraid I can't say anything more. SIS orders.
We just saved your life. Now start talking.
You owe us one.
What does the SIS have to do with this?
You're working with the spies?
That's classified, sir.
What kind of ungrateful, second-rate unit did you put together here?
I'm disappointed, Jorgan.
Out with it, soldier. We're not leaving until we get some answers.
But we--okay, look, we let ourselves get caught. Part of some top secret SIS op.
They implanted tracking devices in us. Plan was to follow us through Imperial space, find out where the Imps ship their POWs, and then come rescue us.
Pretty gutsy to volunteer for a mission like that.
That was brave of you.
Would've done the Republic a lot of good. If it had worked.
Looks like someone forgot to follow through with that last part.
But they didn't rescue you.
The fact that you're still here proves how lame that plan was.
That's a terrible idea.
Tell that to Zane. He was the brains behind all this.
Nobody anticipated the Imps would split us up, send us to labor details. Surprised the SIS didn't spring us, then.
Typical SIS--! Should've known better than to trust those spooks.
Too good an opportunity. You know how many troops we have in those camps.
What if the Imperials had executed you?
He had good intentions, Jorgan.
Go easy on him.
Yeah, and it landed him in an Imperial labor camp with no ticket home. But you're right.
Things wouldn't have been so bad if the SIS had held up their end of the plan.
It's all the SIS's fault.
Got that right. A good soldier never leaves a man behind.
Torve here is as green as you said.
You left this kid in charge?
You said that?
I also said you had potential. I'm sure I'd have done the same in your shoes, Torve.
We'll have it out with the SIS later. For now, just sit tight. I'll call for an evac, get you boys home.
Well, they're off. The SIS better have a good reason for leaving those men behind.
Zane is involved. Maybe he wants to enlighten us.
We know who to ask.
I'm sure he'll have something to say about this rescue op of ours.
Buck up and focus on finding the rest of the Deadeyes.
Get over it.
You got it, sir.
It's not like we have any say in the SIS's operations.
And if they don't?
We do when they start getting our people captured or killed.
Anyway, we've done all we can for now. I'll see about getting the rest of those coordinates decrypted.
You with the rescue party?
